thread.title: Brexit delay is a 'blow for business'

author: Hannah Finch
title: Brexit delay is a 'blow for business'
text:
Brexit delay is a 'blow for business' More uncertainty means more limbo for business in Devon Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
The decision to delay a crucial vote on Brexit has been described as a blow for business.
Carolyn Fairbairn, Director-General of the CBI, said that the country risks sliding towards a national crisis.
She said: “This is yet another blow for companies desperate for clarity. Investment plans have been paused for two and a half years. Unless a deal is agreed quickly, the country risks sliding towards a national crisis.
“Politicians on both sides of the Channel need show leadership, by building consensus to protect both the UK and EU’s prosperity. No one can afford to head into Christmas with the threat of no-deal costing jobs and hitting living standards.” Read More Half of Devon wants a second vote on Brexit - and most would vote remain
Prime Minister Theresa May is to travel to Europe to seek concessions on her Brexit deal, after calling off the crunch House of Commons vote in which she was expected to go down to a heavy defeat.
In a statement to MPs, Mrs May also said the Government was stepping up preparations for a possible no-deal Brexit. Read More
Mrs May’s statement came amid dramatic scenes at Westminster, as news of her plan to postpone Tuesday’s “meaningful vote” broke just minutes after Downing Street had insisted it was going ahead. Read More
